name: Refried Beans Without the Refry
author: CHEFCLAUDE
summary: Refried beans are simple to make when cooked in a slow cooker.  This recipe will yield flavorful, fat-free refried beans seasoned with garlic, jalapeno, and cumin.
ingredients: ½  fresh jalapeno pepper, seeded and chopped
1 ¾ teaspoons fresh ground black pepper
directions: Place the onion, rinsed beans, jalapeno, garlic, salt, pepper, and cumin into a slow cooker
Pour in the water and stir to combine
Cook on High for 8 hours, adding more water as needed
Note: if more than 1 cup of water has evaporated during cooking, then the temperature is too high
Once the beans have cooked, strain them, and reserve the liquid
Mash the beans with a potato masher, adding the reserved water as needed to attain desired consistency
